comment.text: This translation key is used to display the title of a smart banner component on mobile devices. It will be translated as "{{organizationName}} Documents" and appears in the banner's title field when displayed on touch-enabled devices.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Greek translation 'Έγγραφα {{organizationName}}' lacks the article 'of' that would be present in a more natural English equivalent ('{{organizationName}} Documents' translates more closely to 'Έγγραφα του {{organizationName}}').
The English content '{{organizationName}} Documents' is more naturally translated as 'Documentos de {{organizationName}}' in Spanish.  The current translation omits the preposition 'de'.
The French translation lacks a colon after 'Documents'. The English version includes a colon, and it's common to maintain that in translated titles/labels for consistency.
The Italian translation 'Documenti {{organizationName}}' is not a natural or idiomatic way to express "{{organizationName}} Documents". It lacks an article (like 'I' or 'Gli') before 'Documenti'.
The Dutch translation uses a hyphen instead of a space between '{{organizationName}}' and 'documenten'. This can make the text less readable and less natural in Dutch.

The translation "Documentos {{organizationName}}" doesn't accurately convey the original meaning of "{{organizationName}} Documents".  A more accurate translation would be "Documentos da {{organizationName}}" or "Documentos {{organizationName}} (of)". The omission of a preposition makes the translation less natural in Portuguese.

The translation "Documentos {{organizationName}}" is too literal and doesn't flow naturally in Portuguese. A better translation would incorporate the organization name more seamlessly, e.g., "Documentos da {{organizationName}}" or "Documentos {{organizationName}}" (with a more contextual phrase preceding).

The Romanian translation "{{organizationName}} Documente" uses the plural form of "document" (Documente). Since the English version uses the plural form "Documents", this is acceptable. However, depending on the context, using the singular form "{{organizationName}} Document" might be more appropriate.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using "{{organizationName}} Document" if referring to a single document.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Документи {{organizationName}}' is technically correct but lacks the article 'of' or similar preposition that would be present in the English version '{{organizationName}} Documents'. A more natural Ukrainian translation would include a preposition connecting the two parts.
